President Trump broke the lock on the international deal that caged Iran’s nuclear ambitions: the Iran Nuclear Agreement. War with Iran would be a disaster—even worse than Bush’s invasion of Iraq, which I vocally opposed in the House.
The weight of wars started in a conference room is rarely borne by those who start them—but rather paid for in blood by our servicemembers and by civilians.

Or in long nights of difficult negotiations—like those that led to the Iran Nuclear Agreement he broke.

May he finally learn the courage required to choose peace. And to reject the advice of warmongers like Secretary Pompeo and Security Advisor John Bolton.

President Trump ultimately made the correct choice. From this horrifyingly close call, he hopefully learns the lesson that real strength can be found not just in bombings or destruction. That real strength can be shown in restraint. https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.nytimes.com/2019/06/20/world/middleeast/iran-us-drone.amp.html …
